channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: Trump Sends Thousands Of More Troops To LA As Immigration Protests Intensify

media:content.media:description: US military said a battalion would be sent to help protect federal property.

item.description: US President Donald Trump has ordered the temporary deployment of about 700 Marines to Los Angeles, as he pledged those protesting his aggressive immigration policies would be "hit harder" than ever.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump has ordered the temporary deployment of about 700 Marines to Los Angeles, as he pledged those protesting his aggressive immigration policies would be "hit harder" than ever.

item.title: Trump Says Meeting On Iran Planned For Thursday

media:content.media:description: "We're doing a lot of work on Iran right now," Trump told reporters at the White House.

item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said the U.S. and Iran would continue talks on Thursday for a nuclear deal, adding that Tehran was a tough negotiator and that the main impediment to an agreement was over enrichment.
item.content:encoded: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said the U.S. and Iran would continue talks on Thursday for a nuclear deal, adding that Tehran was a tough negotiator and that the main impediment to an agreement was over enrichment.

item.title: Gaza's Al-Amal Hospital "Virtually Out Of Service": WHO

media:content.media:description: Israeli authorities have recently allowed in some humanitarian aid, but way less than what is needed.

item.description: The Al-Amal Hospital in Gaza, one of the few still operating in the Palestinian territory, is now "virtually out of service" due to intense military activity, the head of the WHO said Monday.
item.content:encoded: The Al-Amal Hospital in Gaza, one of the few still operating in the Palestinian territory, is now "virtually out of service" due to intense military activity, the head of the WHO said Monday.

item.title: Israeli Commandos Intercept Greta Thunberg's Gaza-Bound 'Freedom Flotilla' Ship
item.description: Israeli commandos have intercepted the humanitarian ship carrying climate activist Greta Thunberg, among others, to the Gaza Strip.
item.content:encoded: Israeli commandos have intercepted the humanitarian ship carrying climate activist Greta Thunberg, among others, to the Gaza Strip.

item.title: Russia's New Drone Strikes Hit Kyiv, Maternity Ward In Odesa: Ukraine

media:content.media:description: Both sides deny targeting civilians in the war that Russia launched against Ukraine over 3 years ago.

item.description: Russia launched another large drone attack on Ukraine, striking Kyiv and damaging a maternity ward in the southern port of Odesa, regional officials said early on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: Russia launched another large drone attack on Ukraine, striking Kyiv and damaging a maternity ward in the southern port of Odesa, regional officials said early on Tuesday.

item.title: Trump Says Iran Is Involved In Gaza Hostage Negotiations

media:content.media:description: Trump said Iran is involved in negotiations aimed at arranging Gaza ceasefire.

item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday Iran is involved in negotiations aimed at arranging a ceasefire-for-hostages deal between Israel and Hamas.
item.content:encoded: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday Iran is involved in negotiations aimed at arranging a ceasefire-for-hostages deal between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: "In Touch With Authorities": Indian Consulate In US On Man Facing Difficulties At Airport

media:content.media:description: A viral video purportedly showed a person being held on the ground by two individuals.

item.description: The Indian Consulate General in New York issued a message regarding the difficulties being faced by an Indian national at the Newark Liberty International Airport.
item.content:encoded: The Indian Consulate General in New York issued a message regarding the difficulties being faced by an Indian national at the Newark Liberty International Airport.

item.title: UN Says Most Flour Delivered In Gaza Looted Or Taken By Starving People

media:content.media:description: According to the UN Food Programme, 4,600 metric tonnes of flour would provide roughly eight days'.

item.description: The United Nations said on Monday that it has only been able to bring minimal flour into Gaza since Israel lifted an aid blockade three weeks ago and that has mostly been looted by armed gangs or taken by starving Palestinians.
item.content:encoded: The United Nations said on Monday that it has only been able to bring minimal flour into Gaza since Israel lifted an aid blockade three weeks ago and that has mostly been looted by armed gangs or taken by starving Palestinians.

item.title: "I Don't Want Civil War, But...": Trump Slams California Governor Amid LA Clashes

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump said that "it would be great" if California Governor was arrested.

item.description: US President Donald Trump said Monday it would be "great" if California Governor Gavin Newsom was arrested, in an extraordinary threat as the two men sparred over protests in Los Angeles.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump said Monday it would be "great" if California Governor Gavin Newsom was arrested, in an extraordinary threat as the two men sparred over protests in Los Angeles.

item.title: Nuclear Watchdog Warns Iran Against Israeli Strikes On Nuke Facilities

media:content.media:description: The Iranian nuclear program "runs wide and deep," Grossi told the Jerusalem Post.

item.description: IAEA chief Rafael Grossi said Iranians warned him that an Israel strike on the country's nuclear facilities could cause Iran to be more determined about developing a nuclear weapon, according to an interview broadcast and published on Monday.
item.content:encoded: IAEA chief Rafael Grossi said Iranians warned him that an Israel strike on the country's nuclear facilities could cause Iran to be more determined about developing a nuclear weapon, according to an interview broadcast and published on Monday.

item.title: Sly Stone, Leader Of 1960s Funk Band, Dies At 82

media:content.media:description: In the early 1970s, Stone became erratic and missed shows. Some members left the band.

item.description: Sly Stone, the driving force behind Sly and the Family Stone, a multiracial American band whose boiling mix of rock, soul and psychedelia embodied 1960s idealism and helped popularize funk music, has died at the age of 82, his family said on Monday.
item.content:encoded: Sly Stone, the driving force behind Sly and the Family Stone, a multiracial American band whose boiling mix of rock, soul and psychedelia embodied 1960s idealism and helped popularize funk music, has died at the age of 82, his family said on Monday.

item.title: US Military To Deploy 700 Marines To Los Angeles As Protests Intensify

media:content.media:description: Los Angeles faced a possible fourth day of protests over immigration raids in the city.

item.description: The U.S. military will temporarily deploy about 700 Marines to Los Angeles until more National Guard troops can arrive, marking another escalation in President Donald Trump's response to street protests over his aggressive immigration policies.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. military will temporarily deploy about 700 Marines to Los Angeles until more National Guard troops can arrive, marking another escalation in President Donald Trump's response to street protests over his aggressive immigration policies.

item.title: Canada To Pour Extra Billions To Meet NATO's 2% Military Spending Target

media:content.media:description: Canada has been under pressure from US and other NATO allies to increase funding for its military.

item.description: Canada's Liberal government will pour extra billions into its armed forces and hit NATO's 2% military spending target this fiscal year, much earlier than scheduled, Prime Minister Mark Carney said on Monday.
item.content:encoded: Canada's Liberal government will pour extra billions into its armed forces and hit NATO's 2% military spending target this fiscal year, much earlier than scheduled, Prime Minister Mark Carney said on Monday.

item.title: Mpox Is Still A Health Emergency, Says WHO

media:content.media:description: The WHO first declared the emergency in August last year.

item.description: The mpox outbreak is still a public health emergency, the World Health Organization said on Monday, with the health body's director-general issuing a revised set of temporary recommendations.
item.content:encoded: The mpox outbreak is still a public health emergency, the World Health Organization said on Monday, with the health body's director-general issuing a revised set of temporary recommendations.

item.title: "Incompetent, Liar": Trump As California Governor Plans To Sue Him Amid Protest
item.description: Gavin Newsom, the Governor of California, announced on Monday that he plans to sue the President over his administration's crackdown over protests that have rocked Los Angeles over the last 72 hours.
item.content:encoded: Gavin Newsom, the Governor of California, announced on Monday that he plans to sue the President over his administration's crackdown over protests that have rocked Los Angeles over the last 72 hours.

item.title: The 3rd UN Ocean Conference: Why India, World Can't Ignore It
item.description: What do a fisherman in Kerala, a scuba diver off the coast of the Andamans, and a child building sandcastles on Juhu Beach have in common? They all depend on healthy oceans - whether for food, income, wonder, or simply joy.
item.content:encoded: What do a fisherman in Kerala, a scuba diver off the coast of the Andamans, and a child building sandcastles on Juhu Beach have in common? They all depend on healthy oceans - whether for food, income, wonder, or simply joy.

item.title: Frederick Forsyth, UK Author Known For Spy Novels, Dies At 86

media:content.media:description: Frederick Forsyth went on to write a string of bestsellers including "The Odessa File".

item.description: A pilot who turned to writing to clear his debts, British author Frederick Forsyth, who died Monday aged 86, penned some 20 spy novels, often drawing on real-life experiences and selling 70 million copies worldwide.
item.content:encoded: A pilot who turned to writing to clear his debts, British author Frederick Forsyth, who died Monday aged 86, penned some 20 spy novels, often drawing on real-life experiences and selling 70 million copies worldwide.

item.title: Wall Street Investors Wait And Watch As US, China Hold Trade Talks In UK

media:content.media:description: On Monday, representatives from the world's two biggest economies gathered in London for trade talks.

item.description: Wall Street stocks were little changed early Monday as investors awaited details from trade talks between the United States and China in London
item.content:encoded: Wall Street stocks were little changed early Monday as investors awaited details from trade talks between the United States and China in London

item.title: Trump Says He Would Support Arrest Of California Governor Newsom

media:content.media:description: Trump suggested that he would support arrest of California Governor Gavin Newsom.

item.description: US President Donald Trump on Monday suggested that he would support an arrest of California Governor Gavin Newsom amid pro-immigration protests in the state, which prompted the president to deploy the National Guard.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump on Monday suggested that he would support an arrest of California Governor Gavin Newsom amid pro-immigration protests in the state, which prompted the president to deploy the National Guard.

item.title: World Bank Data On India And Pakistan Shows Massive Contrast Over Poverty

media:content.media:description: World Bank data reveals India alleviated more people out of poverty than Pakistan's entire population

item.description: Latest data released by the World Bank shows the tale of two countries - India and Pakistan - and their journey to battle poverty - a colonial inheritance.
